abstract: The hospital chain’s decision to sell $1 billion in debt — after giving its private equity owners a $1.75 billion special dividend — has surprised several analysts, who are concerned about its already large $25 billion debt load.
snippet: The hospital chain’s decision to sell $1 billion in debt — after giving its private equity owners a $1.75 billion special dividend — has surprised several analysts, who are concerned about its already large $25 billion debt load.
lead_paragraph: March 5, 2:04 p.m. | Updated: HCA and another analyst have taken issue with parts of Gimme Credit’s analysis of HCA’s bond sale. This revised post includes their comments.

headline.main: HCA’s Latest Surprise for Its Bondholders
